channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023070155
item.description:
Report E-2023070155

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading a trailer box of drums warehousemen noticed a puddle of material under a drum upon closer inspection a neighboring ring top drum with a long bolt punctured the drum of Hi-LO (flammables liquids n.o.s) near the top of the drum. the leaking drum was put into an overpack and the mess cleanup up in house. No material leaked out of the trailer as an inspection of the trailer underbody and property was performed.

item.title: Report E-2023070084
item.description:
Report E-2023070084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the seal on the one poly 15 gallon drum of wheel cleaner (un1760) was defective and had released 2 cups of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070083
item.description:
Report E-2023070083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one large forklift battery (un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 cup of acid . The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023060806
item.description:
Report E-2023060806

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: One drum of non regulated material was manifested to Reclaimed Energy. Upon receipt and lab analysis it was determined the material was hazardous (flash point was <140) and actually matched a hazardous waste stream set up for the customer UN1133 Waste Adhesives. Upon conversations with the customer. The waste drum was labeled incorrectly.
